description: In the first episode, we will have our guest Lars Gyrup Brink Nielsen talking about mono-repo in the frontend, we will discuss the advantages of mono-repo, different solution and how Nx is different.
In the second episode, we will have our guest Ankit Sharma talking about Blazor, The new UI framework for C#. We will discuss how its different from asp.net and MVC and other UI frameworks.
In the third episode, we will have our guest Martina Kraus talking about Freelancing. We will discuss how to start freelancing and will address common questions like how to get more work.
In the fourth episode, we will have our guest Siddharth Ajmera talking about Ivy. The new engine for Angular. We will discuss how its different from previous engines and advantages of Ivy.

episode: Brandon Roberts Journey into Open Source
description: Brandon Roberts is a GDE and core team member of NgRx in this episode, he is joining us to share his journey in Tech, How he started Open Source and how he went to work with Angular Team and became the part of NgRx team.
In this episode, we will have our guest Ankit Prajapati talking about SSR and Pre-rendering. We will discuss how it works and how they can help in performance improvement and SEO.
In this episode, we will have our guest Armen Vardanyan talking about best practices. We will discuss how it can impact the performance of your application and how to follow good patterns.
We will discuss the evolution of frontend web development, how it has changed over the years, and which technology made a bigger impact and what's the future of frontend development.

One of the biggest issue while Reactive programming using RxJs is how should we think reactively, we are sure you also have the same question, Jan-Niklas Wortmann from the RxJs core team is joining to discuss the same.

The state management is a hot topic when it comes to web development, we have different libraries like NgRX, Redux, Akit, NgXs, and Vuex. But what we really mean by managing state for application, let's hear it from NgRx core team member Alex.
In this episode, we will discuss what Vue 3 release is all about, how it is different from previous versions, what is composition API, and what is Vite the new dev Tool.

episode: Demystifying ML and AI for beginners
description: While starting with ML and AI, everyone has some questions like, what is the difference, how to start, the real-life use case, and which technology to use? Sayak is Joining us to discuss the same.

Flutter has become one of the most loved frameworks by mobile developers across the world. It supports multiple platforms (Android, IOS, and Web). Kamal will share some insights on how to build apps with Flutter.
In this episode, Sajeetharan is joining us to discuss what is Cloud Native Apps, how to build, and deploy. We will also look at different tools available.

episode: Career Advice for Women's in Tech
description: In this episode, we are going to discuss how women in Tech can take their career to next level, we will be joined by our guests Natalia and Anchal.

In the last few years, lots of developers are getting interested in the Developer Advocate role, but many are still confused, is it sales? or what exactly developer advocates do? whom they advocate for? Let's get the answer from Wassim who works as a Developer Advocate at Microsoft.

NuxtJS is a Vue framework and has grown rapidly in the last few years, we will be joined by Tim Benniks to discuss optimize bundle sizes, how to optimize for static generation and how to create a large application using NuxtJS.

Svelte is a new framework to create frontend and follows a different approach as compared to React or Vue, our guest Matthias Stahl will walk us into more detail on the advantages and how do you use it to create your App.

NgRx is a widely used framework for State Management in Angular, in this episode Nils is going to discuss with us why, how, and where to use NgRx and what's the advantage of using NgRx and share the learning from his Book.
In this episode, our guest Aristeidis Bampakos will share what new in Angular 10 and 11 and will share some learning from his book.

episode: bit - A better way to build with modern components
description: Debbie O'Brien works as a head of Developer Advocate at bit, she is joining for this about to talk about the bit platform, advantages of using bit, frameworks supported, and how to get started.

In this episode Siddhart who works as Staff Software Engineer at Gatsby is joining us to talk about how you can start learning Gatsby, the advantages and the use cases for Gatsby and we will talk about Gatsby cloud and upcoming features.
David Dal Busco the creator of DeckDeckGo is Joining us to talk about the Stencil framework, we will discuss how you can get started with the framework, the advantages, and web component support.
Nader Dabit who works as DevRel at Edge & Node is joining us to talk about  AWS Amplify, we will discuss the features, platform support, and how you can start using AWS Amplify.
